abstract: Editorial seconds deep skepticism voiced by Sec of Defense Ashton Carter in reference to failures of Iraqi security forces, who have repeatedly demonstrated an insufficient will to beat back onslaught by Islamic State; questions wisdom of continued American support, arguing that most effective path would be to directly arm and train Sunni tribal fighters, proposal that has been vociferously opposed by Shiite-led central government.
lead_paragraph: Given the weakness of Iraqi forces, Americans should be training and giving weapons directly to Sunni tribal fighters in Anbar Province.

headline.main: Who’s Willing to Fight for Iraq?
headline.print_headline: Who’s Willing to Fight for Iraq?

snippet: Given the weakness of Iraqi forces, Americans should be training and giving weapons directly to Sunni tribal fighters in Anbar Province.
